greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 if the k-th arithmetic derivative is nonzero for all k >= 0, otherwise 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
formula: a(n) = 1 if n is in A100716 or ends there by repeated applications of A003415, otherwise a(n) = 0 (when n instead reaches 0 by such iteration).
For all n > 0, a(n) >= [A129251(n)>0], i.e., if A129251(n) is nonzero, then certainly a(n) = 1.
program: A003415checked(n) = if(n<=1, 0, my(f=factor(n), s=0); for(i=1, #f~, if(f[i,2]>=f[i,1],return(0), s += f[i, 2]/f[i, 1])); (n*s));
xref: Cf. A099308 (positions of zeros), A099309 (of ones).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 28 2021
